name: Sickle Claw
description: Strike with your enlarged toe claw. 30% chance for double damage.
scientificNote: Deinonychus' sickle claw was held off the ground while running and deployed during attacks.

name: Pack Coordination
description: Passive: Deal 20% bonus damage when above 80% health.
scientificNote: Fossil evidence suggests Deinonychus hunted in coordinated groups.

name: Feathered Agility
scientificNote: Feathers provided insulation and may have aided in balance during quick movements.

name: Tail Club Counter
description: Counter 40% of incoming melee damage back to attacker.
scientificNote: Ankylosaurus' tail club could swing with approximately 14,000 Newtons of force.

name: Fortify
scientificNote: Ankylosaurus could hunker down, presenting only armor to attackers.

name: Armored Hide
description: Passive: Reduce all incoming damage by 3.
scientificNote: Bony osteoderms covered most of Ankylosaurus' body.

name: Immovable
description: Passive: Cannot be flanked or surprised.
scientificNote: With its low center of gravity and armor, Ankylosaurus was extremely difficult to overturn.

name: Aerial Scout
description: Reveal the next 2 encounters on the map. Can only be used outside combat.
scientificNote: Pteranodon's excellent vision allowed it to spot prey from great heights.

name: Dive Attack
description: Strike from above. Always goes first in combat turn.
scientificNote: Pteranodon could build tremendous speed in a dive.

name: Escape Flight
description: Flee from combat without penalty. Always succeeds.
scientificNote: Flight gave pterosaurs unmatched mobility and escape options.

name: First Strike
description: Passive: Always act first on turn 1 of combat.
scientificNote: Aerial predators rely on surprise and speed.

name: Evasive
scientificNote: Pteranodon's maneuverability in flight made it difficult to catch.

name: Crushing Bite
description: Devastating bite attack. 200% damage but costs 50 stamina.
scientificNote: T. rex's bite force was the strongest of any land animal, capable of crushing bone.

name: Terrifying Roar
description: Reduce enemy attack by 3 for 3 turns.
scientificNote: As an apex predator, T. rex's presence alone would intimidate most creatures.

name: Apex Strike
description: Massive attack dealing 250% damage. 5 turn cooldown.
scientificNote: T. rex could deliver devastating attacks with its massive jaws and teeth.
